channel.title: Æ DNS? Help Please :P Æ
channel.description:
Windows live has this thing called [url=http://g.live.com/1MBAMen-us/sc_domains] "Custom Domains" [/url]
So i signed up and i had this account called "007pkerz@007pkerz.com" on hotmail. (Used Java Injection)
So i verified that it was mine. They give me this: [IMG]http://i21.tinypic.com/25rcfir.jpg[/img]
I didnt really mess with DNS before so i dont think i know where it is :P. I have Apache (cPanel)...
So what would i have to do to make this "work"? Thanks

item.title: Æ DNS? Help Please :P Æ
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[quote=“Bobby, post:6, topic:147176”]hmm maybe try aol. they have this deal where you get a free domain name for email: Anyhting@anyhting.com or .net[/quote]na i dont want that… i just need that dns thingy[br][size=1]Posted on: September 29, 2007, 07:55:07 PM[/size][hr]k found out its:
http://www.enom.com/ registered there

Read full topic

item.title: Æ DNS? Help Please :P Æ
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Well you need to find out where you registered the domain, nobody can find out for you, because whoever did it decided to put false information in the contact stuff. (Which can get your domain taken off you, by the way)

Read full topic

item.title: Æ DNS? Help Please :P Æ
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

MX = ?
and i dont know where i registered… because I didnt… lol… somone gave me… but i have cPanel X

Read full topic

item.title: Æ DNS? Help Please :P Æ
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You need to change the MX server to what they said at whereever you registered the domain. I can’t be more specific unless you say where you registered it, because all domain control panels are different.

Read full topic
